{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.datable.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   ( geogName | model.geogNamePart )?,
   date
}

<damage>

<damage> Contains an area of damage to the physical medium.
Module MEI.edittrans
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.agentIdent (@agent) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
degree Records the degree of damage.
Status Optional
Datatype string
Member of
model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic subst supplied
MEI.header: contentItem
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.shared: addrLine annot desc head identifier labelAbbr p rend score section titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl biblList castList date dimensions eventList extent identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository scoreDef section staffDef staffGrp term title
MEI.text: list q quote
character data
Note

In no case should <damage> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <damage> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element damage
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.agentIdent.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute degree { string }?,
   (
      text
    | model.divLike
    | model.editLike
    | model.editTransPart
    | model.fLike
    | model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    | model.keyAccidLike
    | model.layerPart
    | model.milestoneLike.music
    | model.neumeComponentModifierLike
    | model.neumeModifierLike
    | model.neumePart
    | model.sectionPart
    | model.staffGrpLike
    | model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}

<date> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<date> A string identifying a point in time or the time period between two such points.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.calendared (@calendar) att.datable (@enddate, @isodate, @notafter, @notbefore, @startdate) att.edit (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence))
Member of
model.dateLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: availability change condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance pubStmt useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer creation date desc dimensions edition editor event eventList extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term titlePage
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Schematron checks for the existence of an notbefore with a larger value than its corresponding notafter (for dates AC)

<sch:report test="(@notbefore gt @notafter) and not(starts-with(@notbefore, '-'))">value of notBefore greater than notAfter</sch:report>
Schematron checks for the cooccurence of date and duration attributes

<sch:report test="(@startdate or @enddate) and (@isodate or @notafter or @notbefore)">cooccurence of date and duration attributes</sch:report>
Schematron checks for the cooccurence of exact and uncertain date attributes

<sch:report test="@isodate and (@notafter or @notbefore)">cooccurence of exact and uncertain date attributes</sch:report>
Schematron If a date is present it must either have an attribute isodate, notbefore, notafter, startdate or enddate. Alternatively the content of date may contain at least four zeros, "unknown" or "o.J.", which qualifies as undated.

<sch:assert test="@isodate or @notbefore or @notafter or @startdate or @enddate or @cert='unknown' or matches(., '0000|o\.J\.|unknown')">mei:date benötigt ein Attribut @isodate, @notbefore o.ä.</sch:assert>
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element date
{
   att.calendared.attributes,
   att.datable.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike )*
}

<del>

<del> (deletion) – Contains information deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
Module MEI.edittrans
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.edit (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.textRendition (@altrend, @rend) att.trans (att.sequence (@seq))
Member of
model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic subst supplied
MEI.header: contentItem
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.shared: addrLine annot desc head identifier labelAbbr p rend score section titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl biblList castList date dimensions eventList extent identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository scoreDef section staffDef staffGrp term title
MEI.text: list q quote
character data
Note

The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand of the deletion. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the hand of the deletion. The hand of the agent which made the deletion should be pointed to using the hand attribute. The rend attribute may be used to record the method used to make the deletion (overstrike, strike[through], etc.).

In no case should <del> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <del> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element del
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.textRendition.attributes,
   att.trans.attributes,
   (
      text
    | model.divLike
    | model.editLike
    | model.editTransPart
    | model.fLike
    | model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    | model.keyAccidLike
    | model.layerPart
    | model.milestoneLike.music
    | model.neumeComponentModifierLike
    | model.neumeModifierLike
    | model.neumePart
    | model.sectionPart
    | model.staffGrpLike
    | model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}

<desc>

<desc> (description) – Container for text that briefly describes the feature to which it is attached, including its intended usage, purpose, or application as appropriate.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element desc
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   (
      text
    | model.textPhraseLike.limited
    | model.editLike
    | model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}

<dimensions>

<dimensions> Information about the physical size of an entity; usually includes numerical data.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.evidence (@cert, @evidence) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.measurement (@unit)
Member of
model.physDescPart model.textPhraseLike.limited
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physDesc physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent head identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

The elements <height>, <width>, <depth>, and <dim> are available for circumstances that require the capture of the individual dimensions of an object. Do not confuse this element with the <extent> element, which is used to indicate the quantity of described materials.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:physDesc/mei:dimensions">
<sch:assert test="not(count(mei:depth) > 1)">The depth element may only appear
once.</sch:assert>
<sch:assert test="not(count(mei:height) > 1)">The height element may only appear
once.</sch:assert>
<sch:assert test="not(count(mei:width) > 1)">The width element may only appear
once.</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element dimensions
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.evidence.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.measurement.attributes,
   macro.struc-unstrucContent
}

<edition>

<edition> (edition designation) – A word or text phrase that indicates a difference in either content or form between the item being described and a related item previously issued by the same publisher/distributor (e.g. 2nd edition, version 2.0, etc.), or simultaneously issued by either the same publisher/distributor or another publisher/distributor (e.g. large print edition, British edition, etc.).
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Member of
model.editionLike
Contained by
MEI.header: editionStmt
MEI.shared: titlePage
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions editor extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository respStmt term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element edition
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited | editor | respStmt | textLang )*
}

Module MEI.header

<event> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<event> Contains information concerning an event.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.bibl (@analog) att.datable (@enddate, @isodate, @notafter, @notbefore, @startdate) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.basic (@xml:base) att.id (@xml:id) att.labelled (@label) att.nNumberLike (@n)
type Designation which characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology that employs single-token labels.
Derived from att.typed
Status Optional
Datatype 1–∞ occurrences of NMTOKEN separated by whitespace
Legal values are:
ua
(world's premiere) contains information about the world's premiere.
ea
(premiere) contains information about the premiere on a certain place.
pa
(private performance) contains information about a private performance.
Contained by
MEI.shared: eventList
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName geogName persName settlement
MEI.shared: biblList date p
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element event
{
   att.basic.attribute.xmlbase,
   att.id.attribute.xmlid,
   att.labelled.attribute.label,
   att.nNumberLike.attribute.n,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.datable.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute type { list { ( "ua" | "ea" | "pa" )+ } }?,
   date*,
   ( geogName* & settlement* ),
   ( persName* & corpName* ),
   model.pLike*,
   biblList*
}

<eventList>

<eventList> Contains historical information given as a sequence of significant past events.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
model.listLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.frbr: expression
MEI.header: history provenance work
MEI.shared: annot eventList p titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.shared: address biblList date event eventList head
Note

An <eventList> contains <event> elements that capture a brief description of the associated event, including dates and locations where the event took place. An <eventList> describes events associated with a work when it appears in the <workList> element or events associated with the custodial history of a given copy of a source for the encoding when it appears within the <sourceDesc> or <relatedItem> elements. The type attribute may be used to distinguish between event lists with different functions, such as a list of events in the compositional process and a list of performance dates.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element eventList
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   (
      (
         name
       | model.addressLike
       | model.dateLike
       | model.nameLike.agent
       | model.nameLike.geogName
      )?,
      ( event | eventList )
   )*,
   biblList*
}

<expression> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<expression> Intellectual or artistic realization of a work.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.frbr
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
model.expressionLike
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expressionList
MEI.header: componentList
May contain
MEI.header: componentList contents history langUsage notesStmt perfDuration perfMedium
MEI.shared: arranger biblList creation desc editor eventList head identifier incip relationList title
Note

The <perfDuration> element captures the intended duration of the expression, while <extent> records scope of the expression in other terms, such as number of pages, measures, etc.
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element expression
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   model.identifierLike*,
   title,
   desc?,
   arranger*,
   editor*,
   model.workIdent*,
   creation?,
   eventList?,
   history?,
   langUsage?,
   perfMedium?,
   perfDuration?,
   contents?,
   biblList*,
   notesStmt?,
   componentList?,
   relationList?
}

<expressionList>

<expressionList> Gathers bibliographic expression entities.
Module MEI.frbr
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type))
Contained by
MEI.header: work
May contain
MEI.frbr: expression
MEI.shared: head
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element expressionList
{
   att.common.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   model.expressionLike*
}

<extent> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<extent> Used to express size in terms other than physical dimensions, such as number of pages, records, bytes, physical components, etc.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.quantity (@quantity) (att.measurement (@unit))
Member of
model.physDescPart model.textPhraseLike.limited
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem fileDesc hand perfDuration perfRes physDesc physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

Use the <dimensions> element when it is necessary to specify the physical size of materials being described, for example, height and width.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element extent
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.quantity.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}

<fileDesc>

<fileDesc> (file description) – Contains a full bibliographic description of the MEI file.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Contained by
MEI.header: meiHead
May contain
MEI.header: editionStmt notesStmt pubStmt seriesStmt titleStmt
MEI.shared: extent
Note

Extent in this context represents file size.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element fileDesc
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   titleStmt,
   editionStmt?,
   extent?,
   pubStmt,
   seriesStmt?,
   notesStmt?,
   sourceDesc?
}

<gap>

<gap> Indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether as part of sampling practice or for editorial reasons described in the MEI header.
Module MEI.edittrans
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.edit (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.reasonIdent (@reason)
Member of
model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic subst supplied
MEI.header: contentItem
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.shared: addrLine annot desc head identifier labelAbbr p rend score section titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain Empty element
Note

When material is omitted because it is illegible or inaudible, <unclear> should be used instead. Similarly, use <damage> if the omission is due to damage and <del> if the omission is because the material is marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. An indication of how much material has been omitted from the transcription may be recorded in the extent attribute. The unit attribute names the unit used for describing the extent of the gap. The reason attribute gives the reason for omission. Sample values include 'sampling', 'irrelevant', 'cancelled'. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor, transcriber or encoder responsible for the decision not to provide any transcription of the material and hence the application of the <gap> tag. The hand attribute signifies the hand which made the deletion in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the extent of the missing material.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element gap
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.reasonIdent.attributes,
   empty
}

<geogName> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<geogName> (geographic name) – The proper noun designation for a place, natural feature, or political jurisdiction.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.namesdates
Attributes
codedval
Status Recommended
Datatype hwh.places.pointer
type
Status Required
Datatype hwh.place.type
Member of
model.nameLike.geogName
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer creation date desc dimensions edition editor event eventList extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

Examples include Black Forest; Baltimore, Maryland; and Quartier Latin, Paris. Geographic name parts can be encoded using <geogName> sub-elements. For greater specificity, however, use <district>, <settlement>, <region>, <country>, and <bloc> sub-elements. The name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), may be recorded using the auth attribute.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standard.
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element geogName
{
   attribute codedval { hwh.places.pointer }?,
   attribute type { hwh.place.type },
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike | model.editLike | model.transcriptionLike )*
}

<hand>

<hand> Defines a distinct scribe or handwriting style.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.evidence (@cert, @evidence) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.medium (@medium)
initial Marks this hand as the first one of the document.
Status Optional
Datatype
Contained by
MEI.header: handList
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

The initial attribute indicates whether this is the first or main hand of the document. The medium attribute describes the writing medium, e.g., 'pencil', or the tint or type of ink, e.g. 'brown'. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand. The characteristics of the hand, particularly those related to the quality of the writing, such as 'shaky', 'thick', etc. may be described within the content of the <hand> element.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element hand
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.evidence.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.medium.attributes,
   attribute initial { data.BOOLEAN }?,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}

<handList>

<handList> Container for one or more hand elements.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
model.physDescPart
Contained by
MEI.header: physDesc
May contain
MEI.header: hand
MEI.shared: head
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:handList[mei:label]">
<sch:assert role="warning"
 test="count(mei:label) = count(mei:hand)">When labels are used,
usually each hand has one.</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element handList
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   ( label?, hand )*
}

<head>

<head> (heading) – Contains any heading, for example, the title of a section of text, or the heading of a list.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.xy (@x, @y)
Member of
model.headLike
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression expressionList item itemList
MEI.header: availability componentList condition contents editionStmt handList history langUsage notesStmt perfDuration perfMedium perfResList physDesc physMedium plateNum price provenance pubStmt revisionDesc seriesStmt useRestrict watermark workList
MEI.shared: biblList castList dimensions eventList incip physLoc relationList respStmt titlePage
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

One or more <head> elements usually identify the parent element and/or its purpose.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in Encoded Archival Description (EAD), Text Encoding Initiative (TEI), and HTML standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element head
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.xy.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike | model.editLike | model.transcriptionLike )*
}

<history>

<history> Provides a container for information about the history of a resource other than the circumstances of its creation.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression item manifestation
MEI.header: work
MEI.shared: physLoc
May contain
MEI.header: provenance
MEI.shared: biblList castList eventList head p
MEI.text: list quote
Note

To facilitate efficient data interchange, basic information about the circumstances surrounding the creation of bibliographic resources should be recorded within the <creation> element, while the record of ownership and custody should be captured within the history element.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:history[parent::mei:work or parent::mei:expression]">
<sch:assert test="not(mei:acquisition or mei:provenance)">The acquisition and provenance
elements are not permitted in the work or expression context.</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element history
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   ( acquisition | provenance | model.divLike | model.textComponentLike )*
}

<identifier>

<identifier> An alpha-numeric string that establishes the identity of the described material.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
model.identifierLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.frbr: expression item manifestation
MEI.header: availability condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance pubStmt seriesStmt useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p physLoc pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term titlePage
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

Examples include an International Standard Book/Music Number, Library of Congress Control Number, publisher's number, a personal identification number, an entry in a bibliography or catalog, etc. The type attribute may be used to indicate the system from which the identifier was derived.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element identifier
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike | model.editLike | model.transcriptionLike )*
}

<incip>

<incip> (incipit) – The opening music and/or words of a musical or textual work.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
model.incipLike
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression
MEI.header: physDesc
May contain
MEI.header: perfRes perfResList
MEI.shared: annot head role score
Note

The <incipText> element may be used to capture a text incipit, while <score> is available to provide an MEI-encoded musical incipit. Images of an incipit may be referenced using the <graphic> element. An incipit encoded in a text format other than MEI may be placed in the <incipCode> element.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element incip
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   tempo?,
   role?,
   ( clef | clefGrp )?,
   ( perfRes | perfResList )?,
   key?,
   meter?,
   mensuration?,
   (
      model.annotLike
    | model.graphicLike
    | model.scoreLike
    | incipCode
    | incipText
   )*
}

<item>

<item> Single instance or exemplar of a source/manifestation.
Module MEI.frbr
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog) att.pointing (@xlink:actuate, @xlink:role, @xlink:show, @target, @targettype) att.targetEval (@evaluate)
Member of
model.itemLike
Contained by
MEI.frbr: itemList
MEI.header: componentList
May contain
MEI.header: availability classification componentList history notesStmt physDesc
MEI.shared: head identifier physLoc relationList
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element item
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.pointing.attributes,
   att.targetEval.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   model.identifierLike*,
   availability?,
   physDesc?,
   physLoc?,
   history?,
   notesStmt?,
   classification?,
   componentList?,
   relationList?,
   extMeta*
}

<itemList> Gathers bibliographic item entities.

Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type))

MEI.frbr: manifestation
May contain
MEI.frbr: item
MEI.shared: head
Content model

</content>
Schema Declaration 
element itemList { att.common.attributes, model.headLike*, model.itemLike* }

<labelAbbr>

<labelAbbr> A label on the pages following the first.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Member of
model.labelLike
Contained by
MEI.shared: staffDef staffGrp
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element labelAbbr
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   (
      text
    | model.textPhraseLike.limited
    | model.editLike
    | model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}

<language> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<language> Description of a language used in the document.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.canonical (@codedval)
auth A name or label associated with a controlled vocabulary or other authoritative source for this element or its content.
Derived from att.authorized
Status Optional
Datatype string
Legal values are:
ISO 639-1 Code
Name of the used standard.
auth.uri A web-accessible location of the controlled vocabulary or other authoritative source of identification or definition for this element or its content. This attribute may contain a complete URI or a partial URI which is completed by the value of the codedval attribute.
Derived from att.authorized
Status Optional
Datatype
Legal values are:
https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php
URL to the definition of the used standard.
Contained by
MEI.header: langUsage
May contain Empty element
Note

A textual element may be related to this element by setting its xml:lang attribute, which normally takes the form of a code drawn from a coded list, such as ISO639-2b, to the same value as this element's codedval attribute. The name and web location of the authorizing list may be encoded in the auth attribute and the auth.uri attribute, respectively.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standards.
Content model 
<content>
 <valList type="closed" rend="add">
  <valItem ident="aa">
   <desc versionDate="2022-01-26"
    xml:lang="en">Afar</desc>
   <desc versionDate="2022-01-26"
    xml:lang="de">Danakil-Sprache</desc>
   <desc versionDate="2022-01-26"
    xml:lang="fr">afar</desc>

Schema Declaration 
element language
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.canonical.attribute.codedval,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute auth { "ISO 639-1 Code" }?,
   attribute auth.uri
   {
      "https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php"
   }?,
   (
      "aa"
    | "ab"
    | "ae"
    | "af"

<langUsage>

<langUsage> (language usage) – Groups elements describing the languages, sub-languages, dialects, etc., represented within the encoded resource.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression manifestation
MEI.header: work
May contain
MEI.header: language
MEI.shared: head
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element langUsage
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   language+
}

<lb>

<lb> (line beginning) – An empty formatting element that forces text to begin on a new line.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type))
Member of
model.lbLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term titlePage
MEI.text: q quote
May contain Empty element
Note

The n attribute should be used to record a number associated with this textual line. See comment on <verse> element for description of func attribute. Do not confuse this element with the <sb> element, which performs a similar function for musical notation.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element lb { att.common.attributes, empty }

<librettist>

<librettist> Person or organization who is a writer of the text of an opera, oratorio, etc.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.evidence (@cert, @evidence) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Member of
model.respLikePart
Contained by
MEI.header: editionStmt seriesStmt work
MEI.shared: titlePage
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element librettist
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.evidence.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}

<list> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<list> A wrapper for persNames or corpNames
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.text
Attributes att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) att.labelled (@label) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.nNumberLike (@n) att.xy (@x, @y)
form Used to indicate the format of a list. In a "simple" list, <li> elements are not numbered or bulleted. In a "marked" list, the sequence of the list items is not critical, and a bullet, box, dash, or other character is displayed at the start of each <item>. In an "ordered" list, the sequence of the items is important, and each <li> is lettered or numbered. Style sheet functions should be used to specify the mark or numeration system for each <li>.
Status Optional
Legal values are:
simple
Items are not numbered or bulleted.
marked
Bullet, box, dash, or other character is displayed before each item.
ordered
Each item is numbered or lettered.
type Captures the nature of the content of a list.
Status Optional
Datatype NMTOKENS
Suggested values include:
gloss
Each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item.
index
Each list item is an entry in an index such as the alphabetical topical index at the back of a print volume.
instructions
Each list item is a step in a sequence of instructions, as in a recipe.
litany
Each list item is one of a sequence of petitions, supplications or invocations, typically in a religious ritual.
syllogism
Each list item is part of an argument consisting of two or more propositions and a final conclusion derived from them.
Note

In a list of type "gloss" it is a semantic error not to precede each list item with a label.
Member of
model.listLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: history
MEI.shared: annot p titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName persName
Note

This element is modelled on elements in Encoded Archival Description (EAD), Text Encoding Initiative (TEI), and HTML standards.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:list[contains(@type,'gloss')]">
<sch:assert test="count(mei:label) = count(mei:li)">In a list of type "gloss" all items
must be immediately preceded by a label.</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element list
{
   att.basic.attributes,
   att.labelled.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.nNumberLike.attributes,
   att.xy.attributes,
   attribute form { "simple" | "marked" | "ordered" }?,
   attribute type
   {
      "gloss"
    | "index"
    | "instructions"
    | "litany"
    | "syllogism"
    | xsd:NMTOKENS
   }?,
   persName*,
   corpName*
}

Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.evidence (@cert, @evidence) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)

model.respLikePart

<manifestation> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<manifestation> A bibliographic description of a physical embodiment of an expression of a work.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.frbr
Attributes att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog) att.pointing (@xlink:actuate, @xlink:role, @xlink:show, @target, @targettype) att.recordType (@recordtype) att.targetEval (@evaluate) att.basic (@xml:base) att.labelled (@label) att.nNumberLike (@n) att.typed (@type)
xml:id Regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.
Derived from att.id
Status Optional
Datatype
singleton
Status Optional
Datatype
Member of
model.manifestationLike
Contained by
MEI.header: componentList
May contain
MEI.frbr: itemList
MEI.header: classification componentList contents editionStmt history langUsage notesStmt physDesc pubStmt seriesStmt titleStmt
MEI.shared: creation identifier physLoc relationList
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:manifestation">
<sch:assert test="@xml:id or ancestor::mei:manifestation"> Am Wurzelelement muss eine XML-ID angegeben sein.
</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:manifestation[@singleton eq 'true']">
<sch:assert test="not(mei:itemList)">Item children are not permitted when @singleton
equals "true".</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element manifestation
{
   att.basic.attribute.xmlbase,
   att.labelled.attribute.label,
   att.nNumberLike.attribute.n,
   att.typed.attribute.type,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.pointing.attributes,
   att.recordType.attributes,
   att.targetEval.attributes,
   attribute xml:id { wega.sources.pointer }?,
   attribute singleton { data.BOOLEAN }?,
   model.identifierLike*,
   titleStmt?,
   macro.bibldescPart,
   creation?,
   history?,
   langUsage?,
   contents?,
   notesStmt?,
   classification?,
   itemList?,
   componentList?,
   relationList?
}

<mdiv> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<mdiv> (musical division) Contains a subdivision of the body of a musical text.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.id (@xml:id) att.labelled (@label)
n Provides a number-like designation that indicates an element's position in a sequence of similar elements. May not contain space characters.
Derived from att.nNumberLike
Status Optional
Datatype string
type (type) Gives the kind the musical division is of.
Derived from att.typed
Status Optional
Datatype 1–∞ occurrences of NMTOKEN separated by whitespace
Legal values are:
act
(act) e.g. x-th act of an opera.
prt
(part) e.g. x-th part of an oratorio.
scn
(scene) e.g. x-th scene (of an act) of an opera.
no
(number) e.g. x-th number of an (stage) work.
mvmnt
(movement) e.g. x-th movement of a(n instrumental) work.
Contained by
MEI.shared: body mdiv
May contain
MEI.shared: mdiv
Note

The <mdiv> element may contain one or both of 2 possible views of the music. The score view is the traditional full and open score while the parts view contains each performer's view of the score; that is, his part. These 2 views are necessary because it is not always possible or desirable to generate one from the other. The <score> and <parts> elements are placed here and not directly within the <body> element because score and part characteristics may change from <mdiv> to <mdiv>. For example, the 2nd movement of a symphony may require different performing forces (and therefore different score and part layout) than the other movements. The <mdiv> element may be recursively nested in order to represent music which exhibits this kind of structure. For example, an opera is normally divided into acts, which are in turn divided into scenes.
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element mdiv
{
   att.id.attribute.xmlid,
   att.labelled.attribute.label,
   attribute n { string { pattern = "[1-9]{1}[0-9]{0,2}" } }?,
   attribute type { list { ( "act" | "prt" | "scn" | "no" | "mvmnt" )+ } }?,
   mdiv*
}

<mei> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<mei> contains a single MEI-conformant document, consisting of an MEI header and a musical text, either in isolation or as part of an meiCorpus element.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.meiVersion (@meiversion)
xml:id
Status Required
Datatype
status
Status Required
Datatype hwh_docStatus.list
source
Status Required
Legal values are:
HWH
works from the database of the Henze-Digital project (HWH).
Contained by
—
May contain
MEI.header: meiHead
MEI.shared: music
XSD string
Note

The <mei> element defines an instance of a document encoded with the MEI schema. It is the document element for a single document containing a header and data. The name of this element should not be changed by any customization in order to assure an absolute minimum level of MEI compliance.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:*[@staff]">
<sch:assert test="every $i in tokenize(normalize-space(@staff), '\s+') satisfies $i=//mei:staffDef/@n">The values in @staff must correspond to @n attribute of a staffDef
element.</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content>duplicatedeletion</content>
Schema Declaration 
element mei
{
   att.meiVersion.attributes,
   attribute xml:id { hwh.works.pointer },
   attribute status { hwh_docStatus.list },
   attribute source { "HWH" },
   (
      ( meiHead, music )
    | element ref
      {
         attribute type { "duplicate" | "deletion" },
         attribute target { hwh.works.pointer },
         empty
      }
   )
}

<meiHead> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<meiHead> (MEI header) – Supplies the descriptive and declarative metadata prefixed to every MEI-conformant text.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) att.bibl (@analog) att.labelled (@label) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.meiVersion (@meiversion)
type Specifies the kind of document to which the header is attached, for example whether it is a corpus or individual text.
Status Optional
Legal values are:
music
Header is attached to a music document.
corpus
Header is attached to a corpus.
independent
Header is independent; i.e., not attached to either a music or a corpus document.
Contained by
MEI.shared: mei
May contain
MEI.header: altId fileDesc revisionDesc workList
Note

In order to encourage uniformity in the provision of metadata across document types, this element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard. This information is often essential in a machine-readable environment. Five sub-elements must be encoded in the following order: <altId>(optional), <fileDesc>(required), <encodingDesc>(optional), <workList>(optional), and <revisionDesc>(optional). These elements and their sub-elements provide: a unique identifier for the MEI file, bibliographic information about the MEI file and its sources, information about the encoding process, information about the creation of the work being encoded, and statements regarding significant revisions of the file. The xml:lang attribute may be used to indicate the language in which the metadata content of the header is provided.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:meiHead[@type eq 'music']">
<sch:assert test="ancestor::mei:mei">The meiHead type attribute can have the value 'music'
only when the document element is "mei".</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
<sch:rule context="mei:meiHead[@type eq 'corpus']">
<sch:assert test="ancestor::mei:meiCorpus">The meiHead type attribute can have the value
'corpus' only when the document element is "meiCorpus".</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
<sch:rule context="mei:meiHead[@type eq 'independent']">
<sch:assert test="not(ancestor::mei:*)">The meiHead type attribute can have the value
'independent' only when the document element is "meiHead".</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element meiHead
{
   att.basic.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.labelled.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.meiVersion.attributes,
   attribute type { "music" | "corpus" | "independent" }?,
   altId*,
   fileDesc,
   workList,
   revisionDesc
}

<music> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<music> Contains a single musical text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example, an etude, opera, song cycle, symphony, or anthology of piano solos.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.shared
Contained by
MEI.shared: mei
May contain
MEI.shared: body
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element music { macro.musicPart }

<notesStmt>

<notesStmt> (notes statement)– Collects any notes providing information about a text additional to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression item manifestation
MEI.header: fileDesc work
May contain
MEI.shared: annot head
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element notesStmt
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   model.annotLike+
}

<p>

<p> (paragraph) – One or more text phrases that form a logical prose passage.
Module MEI.shared
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.xy (@x, @y)
Member of
model.pLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: changeDesc condition contents history perfDuration physDesc physMedium plateNum provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.shared: annot dimensions event titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl biblList castList date dimensions eventList extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: list q quote
character data
Note

A paragraph is usually typographically distinct: The text usually begins on a new line and the first letter of the content is often indented, enlarged, or both.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Encoded Archival Description, Text Encoding Initiative (TEI), and HTML standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element p
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.xy.attributes,
   ( text | model.paracontentPart )*
}

<perfDuration>

<perfDuration> (performance duration) – Used to express the duration of performance of printed or manuscript music or the playing time for a sound recording, videorecording, etc.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
isodur Holds a W3C duration value, e.g., "PT2H34M45.67S".
Status Optional
Datatype duration
Member of
model.physDescPart model.titlePagePart
Contained by
MEI.frbr: expression
MEI.header: physDesc work
MEI.shared: titlePage
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent head identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data

<content>
</content>

{

   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute isodur { xsd:duration }?,
   macro.struc-unstrucContent
}

<perfMedium>

<perfMedium> (performance medium) – Indicates the number and character of the performing forces used in a musical composition.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog)

model.titlePagePart

MEI.header: work
MEI.shared: titlePage
May contain

MEI.shared: annot castList head
Note

Arrangements are coded for the medium of the work being described, not for the original medium.

   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   castList?,
   perfResList?,
   model.annotLike*
}

<perfRes>

<perfRes> (performance resource) – Name of an instrument on which a performer plays, a performer's voice range, or a standard performing ensemble designation.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog) att.edit (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
count Indicates the number of performers.
Status Optional
Datatype positiveInteger
solo Marks this instrument or vocal part as a soloist. Do not use this attribute for a solo instrument which is not accompanied.
Status Optional
Datatype
Contained by
MEI.header: perfRes perfResList
MEI.shared: castItem incip
May contain
MEI.header: perfRes
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data

<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration

{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute count { xsd:positiveInteger }?,
   attribute solo { data.BOOLEAN }?,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited | perfRes )*
}

<perfResList>

<perfResList> Several instrumental or vocal resources treated as a group.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog) att.edit (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
count Indicates the number of performers.
Status Optional
Datatype positiveInteger
Contained by
MEI.header: perfMedium perfResList
MEI.shared: incip
May contain
MEI.header: perfRes perfResList
MEI.shared: annot head
Note

The function of instrumentalists or vocalists is represented by the choice of <perfRes> and <perfResList> child elements. Arrangements are coded for the medium of the work being described, not for the original medium.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element perfResList
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute count { xsd:positiveInteger }?,
   model.headLike*,
   ( annot | perfRes | perfResList )*
}

<persName> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<persName> (personal name) contains a proper noun or proper-noun phrase referring to a person, possibly including one or more of the person's forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names, etc.
Namespace http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
Module MEI.namesdates
Attributes
codedval The WeGA ID of this person, e.g. "A002068" for Carl Maria von Weber
Derived from att.canonical
Status Optional
Datatype
label
Status Optional
Datatype
role The role or relation of this person with the text/score. Values are taken from the MARC Code List for Relators.
Status Recommended
Datatype
cert signifies the degree of certainty or precision of identifying this person.besagt den Grad der Gewissheit oder Präzision der Identifikation der Person.
Status Optional
Datatype teidata.certainty
Member of
model.nameLike.agent
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor event eventList extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository respStmt role roleDesc term
MEI.text: list q quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

Parts of a personal name may be captured using <persName> sub-elements. For greater specificity, however, use foreName, famName, genName, addName, genName, nameLink, and roleName elements. The name of the list from which a controlled value for persName is taken may be recorded using the auth attribute.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standard.
Schematron

<sch:rule context="mei:persName[ancestor::mei:titleStmt]">
<sch:let name="legalValues"
 value="'(arr)|(aut)|(cmp)|(edt)|(editorial_assistant)|(dte)|(lbt)|(lyr)|(trc)|(trl)'"/>
<sch:assert test="matches(@role, $legalValues)">On this level only following roles are allowed: <sch:value-of select="$legalValues"/>.</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>
Content model 
<content/>
Schema Declaration 
element persName
{
   attribute codedval { wega.persons.pointer }?,
   attribute label { teidata.language }?,
   attribute role { marcRelator.list }?,
   attribute cert { teidata.certainty }?,
   (
      text
    | model.textPhraseLike
    | model.editLike
    | model.transcriptionLike
    | model.persNamePart
   )*
}

<physDesc>

<physDesc> (physical description) – Container for information about the appearance, construction, or handling of physical materials, such as their dimension, quantity, color, style, and technique of creation.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
macro.bibldescPart
Contained by
MEI.frbr: item manifestation
May contain
MEI.header: condition handList perfDuration physMedium plateNum watermark
MEI.shared: dimensions extent head incip p titlePage
Note

Dedicatory text and title page features may also be encoded here when they are not transcribed as part of the front or back matter; i.e., when they are considered to be meta-data rather than a transcription.
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>

{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   model.pLike*,
   model.physDescPart*
}

<physLoc>

<physLoc> (physical location) – Groups information about the current physical location of a bibliographic item, such as the repository in which it is located and its shelf mark(s), and its previous locations.

May contain
MEI.header: history
MEI.shared: head identifier repository
Note

This element is modelled on an element in the Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standard.

</content>

{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   ( model.repositoryLike, model.identifierLike* )*,
   history?
}

<physMedium>

<physMedium> (physical medium) – Records the physical materials used in the source, such as ink and paper.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Member of
model.physDescPart
Contained by
MEI.header: physDesc
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent head identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

All materials may be described in a single <physMedium> element or multiple elements may be used, one for each medium.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standard. It has the same function as the material element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration

{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   macro.struc-unstrucContent
}

<plateNum>

<plateNum> (plate number) – Designation assigned to a resource by a music publisher, usually printed at the bottom of each page, and sometimes appearing also on the title page.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)

model.physDescPart model.titlePagePart
Contained by
MEI.header: physDesc
MEI.shared: titlePage
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent head identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

While it is often called a "plate number", it does not always contain numbers. The facs attribute may be used to record the location of the plate number in a facsimile image.
Content model 
<content>
</content>

element plateNum
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   macro.struc-unstrucContent
}

<price>

<price> The cost of access to a bibliographic item.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
amount Numeric value capturing a cost. Can only be interpreted in combination with the currency attribute.
Status Optional
Datatype decimal
currency Monetary unit.
Status Optional
Datatype NMTOKEN
Member of
macro.availabilityPart model.titlePagePart
Contained by
MEI.header: availability
MEI.shared: titlePage
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent head identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

Best practice suggests the use of controlled vocabulary for the currency attribute, such as the ISO 4217 list of currency designators.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element price
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   attribute amount { xsd:decimal { pattern = "[0-9]+\.[0-9]{2}" } }?,
   attribute currency { xsd:NMTOKEN }?,
   model.headLike*,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}

MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions eventList extent head identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository term title

</content>
Schema Declaration

   att.datable.attributes,

      ( model.headLike*, ( eventList | model.pLike )* )
    | ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
   )
}

<pubStmt>

<pubStmt> (publication statement) – Container for information regarding the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item, including the publisher's name and address, the date of publication, and other relevant details.
Module MEI.header
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.bibl (@analog)
Member of
macro.bibldescPart
Contained by
MEI.frbr: manifestation
MEI.header: fileDesc
May contain
MEI.header: availability
MEI.shared: address date head identifier pubPlace publisher respStmt
Note

When an item is unpublished, use only the <unpub> sub-element.

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

</content>

element pubStmt
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   model.headLike*,
   ( unpub? | model.pubStmtPart* )
}

<q>

<q> (quoted) – Contains material which is distinguished from the surrounding phrase-level text using quotation marks or a similar method. Use <quote> for block-level quotations.
Module MEI.text
Attributes att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) att.labelled (@label) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.nNumberLike (@n)
type
Status Optional
Datatype 1–∞ occurrences of NMTOKEN separated by whitespace
Suggested values include:
spoken
Representation of speech.
thought
Representation of thought, e.g. internal monologue.
written
Quotation from a written source.
soCalled
Authorial distance.
foreign
Linguistically distinct.
distinct
Linguistically distinct.
term
Technical term.
emph
Rhetorically emphasized.
mentioned
Refering to itself, not its normal referent.
Member of
model.qLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term title titlePart
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

This element may be used for a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used.

Do not confuse this element, used to capture phrase-level quotations, and <quote>, intended for block quotations.
Note

This element is modelled on elements found in HTML, TEI, and EAD standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element q
{
   att.basic.attributes,
   att.labelled.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.nNumberLike.attributes,
   attribute type
   {
      list
      {
         (
            "spoken"
          | "thought"
          | "written"
          | "soCalled"
          | "foreign"
          | "distinct"
          | "term"
          | "emph"
          | "mentioned"
          | xsd:NMTOKEN
         )+
      }
   }?,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike )*
}

<quote>

<quote> (quoted material) – Contains a paragraph-like block of text attributed to an external source, normally set off from the surrounding text by spacing or other typographic distinction.
Module MEI.text
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.xy (@x, @y)
Member of
model.quoteLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: history
MEI.shared: annot p titlePage
MEI.text: quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl biblList castList date dimensions eventList extent identifier lb p relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: list q quote
character data
Note

The source for the quote may be included in a <bibl> sub-element.

Do not confuse this element, used to capture block-level quotations, and <q>, intended for inline quotations.
Note

This element is modelled on elements found in HTML, TEI, and EAD standards.
Content model 
<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element quote
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.xy.attributes,
   ( text | model.paracontentPart | model.pLike | sp )*
}

<ref>

<ref> (reference) – Defines a traversible reference to another location. May contain text and sub-elements that describe the destination.
Module MEI.ptrref
Attributes att.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.typed (@type)) att.internetMedia (@mimetype) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.pointing (@xlink:actuate, @xlink:role, @xlink:show, @target, @targettype) att.targetEval (@evaluate)
Member of
model.locrefLike
Contained by
MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine annot arranger author bibl composer date desc dimensions edition editor extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository role roleDesc term
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data
Note

Unlike the <ptr> element, <ref> may contain text and sub-elements to describe the destination.
Note

This element is modelled on elements in the Encoded Archival Description (EAD) and TEI standards.

<content>
</content>
Schema Declaration 
element ref
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.internetMedia.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.pointing.attributes,
   att.targetEval.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike )*
}

<region> [http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei]

<region> Contains the name of an administrative unit such as a state, province, or county, larger than a settlement, but smaller than a country.

Module MEI.namesdates
Attributes att.evidence (evidence, @cert)
Member of
model.geogNamePart model.nameLike.agent

MEI.edittrans: add damage del restore sic supplied
MEI.header: condition contentItem hand perfDuration perfRes physMedium plateNum price provenance useRestrict watermark

MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: addrLine address annot arranger author bibl composer creation date desc dimensions edition editor eventList extent head identifier labelAbbr librettist lyricist p pubPlace publisher rend repository respStmt role roleDesc term
MEI.text: q quote
May contain
MEI.edittrans: add damage del gap restore sic subst supplied
MEI.namesdates: corpName country geogName persName region settlement
MEI.ptrref: ref
MEI.shared: address annot bibl date dimensions extent identifier lb relation relationList rend repository term title
MEI.text: q
character data

This element is modelled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.
